text: Ranked in the Top 15 Best Public Regional Universities in the South
For those who seek personalized, hands-on education but crave the excitement of a large university experience — meet Montevallo, where you’ll never get lost in the shuffle.
As Alabama celebrates its 200th birthday this year, Cheyanne Smith is working to make sure one of civilization’s oldest and most important institutions is accessible to all.
Find your new home away from home.
University of Montevallo opens Grainger Family Center for Personal Development

The University of Montevallo will be able to greatly enhance its counseling services to students, faculty and staff after opening the new Grainger Family Center for Personal Development during a Jan. 6 ceremony. The center occupies the newly renovated Puryear House off Middle Street on the UM campus, and increases counseling service space by 85 […]
UM provost honored among ‘Women Who Shape the State’
Todd Strange to serve as fall 2019 commencement speaker, receive honorary doctorate
Private University Education with Public University Tuition
UM out-of-state scholarships valued at up to $12,000 per year can reduce tuition to the in-state rate for select students from outside Alabama.
From finance and marketing to history and political science, our distinguished degree programs and high academic standards prepare students to excel in a constantly evolving world.
Where Innovation and Creativity Meet Practical Problem Solving

The University of Montevallo offers 40  high-impact undergraduate and graduate programs across the four colleges: Arts & Sciences, Stephens College of Business, Education & Human Development, and Fine Arts.

Use the power of our search engine to find the program that’s right for you. Each program is designed to help you prepare for the real world – to solve the problems you are passionate about; to become a thinker AND a doer. We offer a hybrid educational experience that combines deep classroom-based learning with its application on projects that will explore and impact your communities of choice. Come join us in this bold 21
century educational journey and change the world.
Education of Deaf & Hard of Hearing
Special academic offerings for intellectually talented students.
We believe that research is a critical part of the education process.
Helping our students and faculty stay engaged throughout their education.
Broaden your view of the world with other cultures and experiences.

The primary purpose of the academic advising program is to assist students in the development of meaningful educational plans that are compatible with their life goals. Let us help make sure you succeed.
